Plus, analysis from Planet America's John Barron and Chas Licciardello. title: Prime minister evacuated during security scare at Canberra residence | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been forced to evacuate during a security scare at his residence in Canberra. The Australian Federal Police conducted a search of the Lodge for any security threat and found ‘nothing suspicious’.  The prime minister’s office has thanked the officers involved and reaffirmed ‘trust’ in the AFP. title: Politicians slam Andrew in UK parliament as Epstein files fallout grips Westminster | ABC NEWS
description: UK parliamentarians have launched a scathing attack on former prince Andrew in the House of Commons, as revelations from the Epstein files continue to grip British politics.  The unprecedented move marks a break from the tradition of not criticising the royal family at Westminster as British MP Chris Bryant described the former trade envoy as a ‘rude, arrogant and entitled’ man.  The Starmer government is facing mounting pressure after former cabinet member Peter Mandelson was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office. title: The secrecy surrounding the 'ISIS brides' | ABC News Daily podcast
description: The possible return home of a group of so-called ‘ISIS brides’ from Syria has caused a political storm.   But why? Given similar groups of women and children have been returned in the past by both the Albanese and Morrison governments?    Today, Adam Harvey, reporter for the ABC’s 7.30 program, joins us to discuss his 2019 reporting as a foreign correspondent on the ground in the Syrian camp where the Australians were living.    He spoke with some of the Australian women at the time.    Adam also looks at the current debate and what happens if the group is successful in getting home.    Featured:    Adam Harvey, 7.30 reporter

title: Mexican President considers legal action against Elon Musk after cartel claims | ABC NEWS
description: The Mexican President says the country is returning to normal after a wave of cartel violence. Dozens of people have died following the killing of drug cartel boss 'El Mencho.'  Claudia Sheinbaum insists the country will be able to host FIFA World Cup matches despite the safety concerns. Ms Sheinbaum has not ruled out legal action against Elon Musk, after he claimed she was beholden to Mexican drug cartels. description: US television host Savannah Guthrie's family is offering a $US1million ($1.42 million AUD) reward for information leading to the recovery of her mother, Nancy Guthrie. title: The Lodge bomb threat linked to Chinese music, dance group | ABC NEWS
description: The prime minister was forced to evacuate The Lodge due to a bomb threat linked to performances by a classical Chinese dance and music group.  The Shen Yun group — which has been linked to the Falun Gong spiritual movement and is banned in China — is due to hold several concerts in Australia over the coming month.  A newspaper linked to Falun Gong has reported organisers were sent threatening emails demanding the shows be cancelled.  The ABC has now confirmed an email was sent to a Falun Gong supporter, falsely claiming  explosives had been placed around the prime minister's residence, and they'd be detonated if the performances proceeded.
